0.title: Ind cricket was lacking fitness, fielding side of things before Kohli: Deep
0.article_body: Ex-cricketer Deep Dasgupta said that Indian cricket was lacking in the fitness and fielding side of things before Virat Kohli's impact. "Kohli's impact on Indian cricket is humongous," Dasgupta said. He added, "Kohli looks at himself as an athlete as cricket demands a different fitness skill set...I am so glad that he has got his mojo back."

1.title: NIA arrests 3 PFI workers in Praveen Nettaru murder case
1.article_body: The NIA on Saturday arrested three Popular Front of India (PFI) workers from Bengaluru and Dakshina Kannada district in connection with the killing of BJP Yuva Morcha member Praveen Nettaru. The agency carried out raids at five locations in Dakshina Kannada, Hubballi and Mysuru. Digital devices and incriminating documents were allegedly seized from the houses of the accused.

2.title: BJP offered to drop charges against Jain, Sisodia if we left Guj polls: Kejriwal
2.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal has claimed that the BJP offered to dissolve cases against AAP ministers if the party quit the Gujarat Assembly elections. "After Manish Sisodia rejected their offer to be Delhi Chief Minister by leaving AAP, they've approached me now," Kejriwal said. "They've said if you leave Gujarat...we'll spare...Satyendar Jain and Sisodia," he added.

3.title: Case filed against Dr Anahita who drove car that crashed, killing Cyrus Mistry
3.article_body: Dr Anahita Pandole, who was driving the car in which former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was travelling during his accident in September, has been booked by police in Maharashtra. Pandole is still in the ICU and is undergoing treatment due to injuries from the accident. Police recorded her husband Darius Pandole's statement. Mistry was killed in the accident.

4.title: ‘Holy mud’ to be used for unveiling of Kempegowda statue in B'luru
4.article_body: A team of four ministers of the Karnataka government visited three historical places in the state to collect the holy mud to be used during the unveiling of the Kempegowda statue. The soil has been collected from Hampi, Kudalasangama and Kitturu. The 108 feet bronze statue at Bengaluru Airport will be unveiled by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on November 11.

5.title: 19-year-old college student run over by speeding crane dies in B'luru
5.article_body: A 19-year-old college student died at a hospital on Friday, two days after being run over by a mobile crane which was allegedly being driven at high speed in Bengaluru's Whitefield. A CCTV footage showed Noor Fatima, a first-year BCom student, walking on the road before the vehicle hit her. The driver of the crane, Periya Swamy, has been arrested.

6.title: Bank of Baroda posts 59% YoY rise in Q2 net profit to ₹3,313 crore
6.article_body: Bank of Baroda reported a 58.7% year-over-year increase in net profit for the July-September quarter to ₹3,313.42 crore from the previous fiscal's ₹2,087.85 crore. The public sector lender's net interest income surged 34.5% to ₹10,174.46 crore during the second quarter. The bank's gross non-performing assets (NPAs) dropped 22.06% to ₹46,374.4 crore from last September's ₹59,503.82 crore.

7.title: Actor Govinda bumps into his lookalike at Mumbai airport, video surfaces
7.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actor Govinda bumping into his lookalike, who was dressed in a maroon suit and wore sunglasses, at the Mumbai airport. In the video, the lookalike can be seen presenting a bouquet to Govinda and posing with him for the paparazzi. "Who is the real Govinda?" a fan joked. "Same to same," wrote another.

8.title: Virat Kohli cuts birthday cake with Indian journalists at MCG, video goes viral
8.article_body: Indian journalists covering the T20 World Cup 2022 surprised Virat Kohli with a cake at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) on the occasion of his 34th birthday. "Very nice gesture. This is a historic venue and all the media people are here, so it's a very nice gesture," Kohli said. The journalists also presented Kohli with a greeting card.

9.title: Notices sent to 20 rooftop restaurants in Pune for violating norms
9.article_body: Notices have been sent to 20 rooftop restaurants in Pune for violating norms between November 1 and 4, officials said. "We will be taking strict action against illegal rooftop restaurants...Engineers...are personally visiting these restaurants and issuing notices," said a Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) official. This came after a fire broke out in Lulla Nagar on November 1.

10.title: Musk bought outfit that spews lies across the world: US Prez on Twitter deal
10.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday reacted to the world's richest man Elon Musk's Twitter acquisition deal, saying the latter bought "an outfit that...spews lies all across the world". "There are no editors anymore in America...How do we expect kids to be able to understand what is at stake?" Biden added. Musk has called himself a "free speech absolutist".

11.title: When I turn producer, I will tell actors to slash their prices: Rajkummar
11.article_body: Rajkummar Rao, when asked if actors should reduce their prices if their films don't work well, said, "I can't tell others to slash rates...This is the call that...producers will have to take." He added he will ask actors to slash their prices "a bit" when he will become a producer. Rajkummar further said he doesn't charge much for his projects.

12.title: How does the final T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 points table read?
12.article_body: New Zealand, England and Australia accumulated seven points each in Group 1 of T20 World Cup 2022's Super 12 stage. New Zealand and England advanced to the semi-finals with a net run-rate of +2.113 and +0.473, respectively. Afghanistan finished last on the table with three losses in five matches. Ireland won just one match, while Sri Lanka won two matches.

13.title: I got my first salary at the age of 13: Jaya Bachchan
13.article_body: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan, in an episode of her granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda's podcast, revealed that she got her first salary at the age of 13. "I don't even know how much I was paid," she added. Jaya further said when she went to study, she paid for her education as she did not want her father to finance her.

14.title: Sharad Pawar flies to Shirdi from Mumbai with doctors to attend NCP meet
14.article_body: NCP President Sharad Pawar flew to Shirdi today with a team of doctors to attend a party meet. He has been undergoing treatment at the Breach Candy hospital in Mumbai. "I am sure the situation will change...Party cadres wished that I come for the meeting where discussions on the ideology...and policies of the NCP are being discussed," said Pawar.

15.title: You forced me to bring 20-30 people to give ₹500cr cash to AAP: Sukesh to Kejriwal
15.article_body: Conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar, while addressing Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal in a letter, accused the latter of receiving money in exchange for seats. "Kejriwal ji, why you forced me to bring 20-30 more individuals to contribute ₹500 crore cash to AAP in return for seats and postings in AAP Karnataka and Tamil Nadu in 2016?" He alleged.

16.title: Labourers fighting over water fall from Thane building's 2nd floor, 1 dead
16.article_body: Two labourers staying in a building in Thane's Bhiwandi got into a fight over who of the two would go to fetch water from the ground floor. Both of them fell from the second floor of the building, following which one of them died. The other one has been booked for culpable homicide not amounting to murder.

17.title: England reach T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals after win vs SL; Australia knocked out
17.article_body: England advanced to semi-finals of T20 World Cup 2022 after defeating Sri Lanka by four wickets in their last Super 12 stage Group 1 match. England finished second on the points table with seven points and a superior net run-rate than Australia, who have been knocked out of the tournament. New Zealand qualified for semi-finals from Group 1 on Friday.

18.title: Regional parties in T'gana, Andhra are 'match fixing' parties: Jairam Ramesh
18.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that only Congress can fight with the BJP as all the regional parties in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh are "match fixing" parties. "[All the regional parties] have a good understanding with the BJP. All…are scared of ED, I-T and CBI," said Ramesh. He added that Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra will act as a booster.

19.title: Himanshu Vyas joins BJP after resigning from Congress' primary membership
19.article_body: Former Congress leader Himanshu Vyas joined the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Saturday, hours after resigning as the AICC Secretary Incharge of Indian Overseas Congress and from the party's primary membership. He joined the party at the Gujarat BJP office 'Shri Kamalam' and was welcomed by Union Home Minister Amit Shah and State Party President C R Paatil.

20.title: 57-yr-old BMC official caught while accepting ₹50 lakh bribe, booked
20.article_body: A 57-year-old executive engineer of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) was allegedly caught by Anti-Corruption Bureau while accepting ₹50 lakh bribe to stop action against a company for illegal construction in Andheri, an official said. The accused was posted at the BMC's K-east ward. A case has been registered under relevant provisions of the Prevention of Corruption Act.

21.title: Iranian footballer wears slogan against Iran's hijab rule in ISL match, sent off
21.article_body: Iranian footballer Vafa Hakhamaneshi was dismissed after getting his second yellow card during an Indian Super League (ISL) match in Bengal after he revealed his vest with slogans protesting Iran's mandatory hijab rule. Hakhamaneshi went toward the cameras after scoring his first goal in India and lifted his t-shirt to reveal the slogan "#women #life #freedom for 11:11".

22.title: Russia struggling to train newly mobilised troops: UK
22.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said Russia is probably struggling to provide military training for its current mobilisation drive and annual autumn conscription intake. According to the ministry, newly mobilised conscripts likely have "minimal training or no training at all". "Experienced officers and trainers have been deployed to fight in Ukraine and some have likely been killed in...conflict," it added.

23.title: AIIMS Delhi to provide real-time info on beds from Dec 25
23.article_body: AIIMS Delhi will provide real-time status of beds in its general and private wards from December 25 through a 'Patient Care Dashboard' on its website, a memorandum by AIIMS Director Dr M Srinivas said. The website will also provide statistics regarding radiology tests. AIIMS Delhi has already launched a dashboard to show the availability of beds in its emergency department.

24.title: K-pop band NCT 127 ends concert after 30 fans faint in Indonesia
24.article_body: K-pop band NCT 127 was forced to end their first concert in Indonesia's Jakarta abruptly after 30 people fainted in a crush, police said. During the concert, the fans had started surging forward to get closer to the stage and because of this people fainted, the police added. NCT 127 member Taeyong has apologised for creating "bad memories".

25.title: Russia, China bent over backwards to justify North Korea's missile launches: US
25.article_body: US has accused Russia and China of "bending over backwards" to justify North Korea's ballistic missile launches. During a Security Council meeting on Friday, US also said that Russia and China provided "blanket protection" to Pyongyang from UN's actions. Representatives from Russia and China accused the US of escalating tensions by conducting joint military exercises with South Korea.

26.title: Punjab & Sind Bank's Q2 profit rises by 27% to ₹278 crore
26.article_body: Punjab & Sind Bank reported a 27% rise in its net profit to ₹278 crore in the July-September quarter as against ₹218 crore in the year-ago period. This was led by a reduction in bad loans. The lender's total income during the quarter surged to ₹2,120.17 crore. On Friday, the bank's stock closed 8.77% higher at ₹18.60 apiece on BSE.

27.title: BJP sticker seen on car used during IT raid on J'khand MLA, CM reacts
27.article_body: A video has surfaced purportedly showing a BJP sticker on a car in which Income Tax officials arrived to conduct raid at Jharkhand Congress MLA Kumar Jaimangal Singh's residence on Friday. The sticker was later removed by a man wearing a BJP stole. Chief Minister Hemant Soren said, "Where lies morality?...[BJP is] robbing the mandate of people using central agencies."

28.title: Iran acknowledges sending drones to Russia for the first time
28.article_body: Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian has acknowledged that Iran supplied drones to Russia, insisting that the transfer happened before the Russian invasion of Ukraine began. "We gave a limited number of drones to Russia months before the Ukraine war," Amirabdollahian said. Earlier this week, Iran's Ambassador to the UN said the allegations of sending drones were "totally unfounded".

29.title: T'gana CM KCR capable of acting in political field: BJP's NV Subhash
29.article_body: After Telangana CM KCR released a video to back poaching charges against the BJP, the Opposition party has called KCR an actor in the political field. BJP spokesperson NV Subhash called the allegations baseless and unwarranted. "KCR is capable of acting in [the] political field with his lies and dialogues and [can mesmerise] political workers with his lies," said Subhash.

30.title: Mumbai civic body starts resurfacing work on city's 18 roads
30.article_body: After taking verbal permission from the traffic police, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has taken up the work to resurface 18 of the 449 bad roads in Mumbai. "These are small internal roads which need resurfacing as they developed potholes during monsoon," a BMC official said. Out of these 18 roads, 14 are located in the city's western suburbs.

31.title: Man kills his parents & 2 sons, dumps bodies then kills self in Raj
31.article_body: A 38-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after murdering his parents and two sons, aged eight and 14, police said. The accused apparently dumped the bodies in a water tank before jumping into another tank, an SHO said. The police suspect the man drugged his wife and other family members, who were also present in the house, the SHO added.

32.title: Pharma company adopts African lion at Hyd's Nehru Zoological Park
32.article_body: Manohar, an African Lion, at Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park has been adopted by Aurigene Pharmaceutical Services Limited for a period of one year. According to the zoo officials, representatives from the pharmaceutical company handed over a cheque of ₹1 lakh towards the adoption and maintenance charges of the lion. Last year, the company adopted a Royal Bengal tiger.

33.title: Tata Motors to hike prices of passenger vehicles by 0.9% from Nov 7
33.article_body: Tata Motors on Saturday announced a marginal price hike across its passenger vehicles from November 7. "Effective November 7, 2022, the weighted average increase will be 0.9%, depending on the variant and model," the company said in a statement. "The steep rise in overall input costs has compelled...to pass on some proportion through this minimal price hike," the automaker added.

34.title: UP CM directs Noida, Greater Noida authorities to hire more staff
34.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed senior officials of the Noida and Greater Noida authorities to recruit more staff for smooth functioning. Notably, the Noida and Greater Noida authorities are functioning with only 25% staff, officials said. "We requested the CM if he could allocate personnel from the state government...We are also hiring contractual staff," an official said.

35.title: North Korea fires 4 ballistic missiles as US & South Korea end drills
35.article_body: North Korea fired four short-range ballistic missiles into the western sea, South Korean military said. Saturday launches come as US and South Korea wrapped up the "Vigilant Storm" exercise they began on Monday. North Korea has launched a series of missiles this week, raising concerns that it could be preparing to resume nuclear testing for the first time since 2017.

36.title: PM Modi condoles the death of independent India's first voter
36.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday expressed condolences over the death of 106-year-old Shyam Saran Negi who was independent India's first voter. "I bow my head in tribute to him with an emotional heart," he said. Adding that Negi had voted "over 30 times" in his life, the PM further said that this will inspire every citizen, especially the country's youth.

37.title: No communication from DoT since April: Vi on delay in equity conversion
37.article_body: When asked about the delay in the conversion of dues amounting to ₹16,130 crore into equity by the government, Vodafone Idea (Vi) CEO Akshaya Moondra said they are yet to hear from the Centre. "We have had no communication from the DoT since April when there was an agreement...don't know exactly the reason why this is not happening," Moondra said.

38.title: If I'm a 'thug' why did you get ₹50cr to offer RS seat to me?: Sukesh to Kejriwal
38.article_body: Jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar addressed Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, in a letter on Saturday. "Kejriwal ji, if I'm the country's biggest 'thug' according to you, then on what basis you received ₹50 crore from me and offered Rajya Sabha (RS) seat to me?" asked Chandrashekhar. "What does that make you? 'Maha thug'?" he added.

39.title: Fire breaks out in 15-storey building in Thane; residents evacuated
39.article_body: A fire broke out in a 15-storey building in Thane's Thakurli after an electric meter box in the building reportedly caught fire on Saturday morning. The fire spread across the duct comprising electric wires and reached the top floor, covering the building in thick smoke, fire officials said. Fire, however, didn't enter flats and all the residents were evacuated safely.

40.title: 'Jana Gana Mana, Vande Mataram' have equal status: Centre to Delhi HC
40.article_body: The Centre informed the Delhi HC that "Jana Gana Mana" and "Vande Mataram" both stand on the same level and that every citizen should show equal respect to both. The Center's response was to a PIL that asked the government to frame guidelines for the National Song, giving it the same honour and status as the National Anthem.

41.title: Girl collapses, dies after teacher punishes students at B'luru school
41.article_body: A primary schoolgirl collapsed in her classroom on Friday while a teacher was allegedly punishing all the students of her class at a private school in Bengaluru. She was rushed to a hospital by teachers but was declared brought dead, police said. Later, the school authorities took the girl's body to her home. The child's father has lodged a complaint.

42.title: List party workers to be chosen in civic body: Thiruvananthapuram Mayor to CPI(M)
42.article_body: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation Mayor Arya Rajendran allegedly wrote a letter to district secretary Anavoor Nagappan, seeking the priority list of party cadres to be appointed in temporary posts in the civic body. According to reports, Nagappan has said that he had not seen such a letter and that he cannot confirm if the letter was fake.

43.title: SBI posts highest-ever quarterly net profit after 74% YoY rise in Q2
43.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) on Saturday reported its highest-ever quarterly net profit of ₹13,264.62 crore, up nearly 74% year-over-year, for the July-September quarter. The country's largest state-run lender posted a 15% year-over-year increase in interest earned to ₹79,859.59 crore, while interest expended was ₹44,676.15 crore. At the end of Q2, SBI deposits stood at ₹41,90,254.88 crore.

44.title: They arrested my PA after not finding anything in ED raid: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia
44.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday alleged that the Enforcement Directorate raided his personal assistant's residence in connection with the excise policy case and arrested him. "They got my house raided by filing false FIR...but found nothing against me," Sisodia tweeted. "They didn't find anything in ED's raid at my PA's house, so now they've arrested him," he added.

45.title: Kantara is doing really well, Hindi films are getting their a** kicked: Varun
45.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has said people should take inspiration from films like 'Kantara', 'KGF Chapter 2' and 'Vikram', which are "doing really well". He added that Hindi films are "getting their a**** kicked right now". "It is a good time to be collaborative because cinema, in general, we are going through a big transition all over," Varun further said.

46.title: Jay Narayan Vyas quits BJP ahead of Gujarat polls, says he was fed up
46.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls, former Health Minister Jay Narayan Vyas resigned from the BJP and said that he has kept his options open to join the Congress or the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP). "I was fed up with the BJP…I will contest the upcoming Gujarat elections from the Sidhpur constituency," said Vyas.

47.title: BJP MP Mahesh Sharma's close aide attacked in GB Nagar, hospitalised
47.article_body: A BJP worker and a close aide of UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar MP Mahesh Sharma was attacked by unidentified miscreants in Greater Noida, following which he was hospitalised, police said. The victim was with two other BJP workers, police added. Their car was intercepted by around eight unidentified men who were in SUVs and carried arms with them, police stated.

48.title: Russian President Putin calls for 'evacuation' from Kherson region
48.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that civilians in Ukraine's Kherson region should be "evacuated" from the conflict zone. "Those who live in Kherson should be removed from the zone of the most dangerous actions, because the civilian population should not suffer," Putin told pro-Kremlin activists. Kherson is one of the four Ukrainian provinces annexed by Russia in September.

49.title: Peon allegedly rapes teen friend at Delhi govt hospital; arrested
49.article_body: A peon at Delhi government's Rajiv Gandhi Super Speciality Hospital was arrested for allegedly raping a teenage girl, police said on Friday. In her statement, the victim said the accused was her friend whom she had called to meet while she was at the hospital. The accused then allegedly took her to a room in the hospital and raped her.

50.title: MP RTI activist reaches municipality on bullock-cart to collect 9,000-page information
50.article_body: Right to Information activist Makhan Dhakad reached the municipality office in Madhya Pradesh's Bairad town on a bullock cart with a band to collect 9,000-page information in response to his plea. It was a matter of celebration for Dhakad as his application was earlier rejected by the civic body. He had sought information about PMAY around two months back.

51.title: Unacademy's monthly burn down to $7 million from $20 million: CEO
51.article_body: Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal has said that the company has brought down its monthly burn to $7 million from $20 million. This was in response to a Twitter user who said, "Oh, the irony. Isn't Unacademy burning millions?" "Winter will get worse. Get to profitability asap...Stop all unnecessary spends. Focus on building great Products," Munjal said in the tweet.

52.title: Timely complaint helps Mumbai Police freeze ₹2 lakh in fraud case
52.article_body: Mumbai's Azad Maidan Police managed to block ₹2 lakh of a complainant in a fraudster's account after she approached them within the golden hours of the cyber fraud. The complainant, Padmini Nayal, got her amount back within 48 hours after police approached nodal officers of various payment gateways. The crime happened when Nayal was searching online for dormitories in Gujarat.

53.title: China vows to continue with 'dynamic-clearing' COVID-19 strategy
53.article_body: Chinese health officials said that the country will use its "dynamic-clearing" approach to deal with COVID-19 cases as soon as they emerge. "We should adhere to the principle of putting people and lives first," China National Health Commission said. China's strict COVID-19 containment approach is still able to control the virus despite the high transmissibility of COVID-19 variants, it added.

54.title: Be cautious of fake messages promising jobs: National Informatics Centre
54.article_body: The National Informatics Centre (NIC) has cautioned the citizens about fake mobile messages that promise jobs on its behalf. "[Fake SMS] was a cyber incident and could also involve a potential financial fraud, NIC promptly reported the incident...and also registered a complaint with law enforcement agencies for identifying and prosecuting the perpetrators of this fake SMS," the NIC said.

55.title: I fell after being shot, 2nd shooter thought I'd died & he left: Imran Khan
55.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan, who was recently shot at multiple times at a rally in Wazirabad, has said he would not have survived if his two shooters had been "synchronised". Khan said he fell after being shot by the first shooter and consequently the other one left, thinking the PTI chief had died. Four bullets had hit his leg.

56.title: Cloudtail fined ₹1 lakh for sale of substandard pressure cookers
56.article_body: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on online retailer Cloudtail India Private Limited for selling domestic pressure cookers in violation of mandatory BIS standards. The CCPA directed the e-retailer to recall and reimburse prices of 1,033 such pressure cookers sold to consumers and submit a compliance report in 45 days.

57.title: 15 people killed in fire at Russian cafe after flare gun fired
57.article_body: At least 15 people were killed in a fire at a cafe in Russia's Kostroma city on Saturday, local authorities said. The fire erupted in the early hours after someone apparently used a flare gun during a dispute. Police have opened a criminal investigation into the case and are searching for the person who used the flare gun.

58.title: 56-yr-old woman gives birth to her son, daughter-in-law's baby in US
58.article_body: A 56-year-old woman named Nancy Hauck turned surrogate and gave birth to her son and daughter-in-law's baby in US' Utah. The woman gave birth to the couple's fifth child, a daughter. Her daughter-in-law Cambria shared a video of the baby's delivery on Instagram and wrote, "She was carried and brought into the world by her sweet nana."

59.title: Wipro to roll out 100% variable pay up to team leader levels for Q2
59.article_body: Wipro will give 100% variable pay to employees across fresher and team leader levels for September-ended quarter. The 100% hikes for bands A to B3 come after Wipro reported 14.6% jump in Q2 revenue at ₹22,540 crore. For the rest of the employees, the payout will be based on their unit's target achievement. This year, Wipro promoted 16,000 employees internally.

60.title: Elected govt has to exercise responsibilities: HS Puri on Delhi pollution
60.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri, while talking about the pollution situation in Delhi, said that "there are certain responsibilities that an elected government has to exercise". "They are also there in Punjab, look at incidents of stubble burning that had gone up in Punjab," he added. Meanwhile, BJP leader Tajinder Bagga accused Arvind Kejriwal of turning Delhi into gas chamber.

61.title: I earned ₹3,000/month as a teacher in Delhi after getting married: Shweta Bachchan
61.article_body: Speaking with her daughter Navya Naveli Nanda on her podcast, Shweta Bachchan said that after getting married, she had a job as an assistant teacher in a kindergarten in Delhi, where she earned around ₹3,000/month. Shweta stated she was never educated on managing finances, adding, "I was borrowing money (from Abhishek Bachchan) not just in college but in school also."

62.title: Cong always puts obstacles in the way of Himachal's development: Thakur
62.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh polls, Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised the Congress and said that the party has always put obstacles in the way of the development of the state. "Today, Congress is nowhere left in the entire country. Very soon, people are going to throw them out [of] one or two states where they have governments," said Thakur.

63.title: Putin is trying to 'freeze' Ukraine into submission: US
63.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said Russia is trying to "terrorise the civilian population" of Ukraine with attacks on energy and water facilities. "President [Vladimir] Putin seems to have decided that if he can't seize Ukraine by force, he'll try to freeze it into submission," Blinken added. Ukraine has said that Russian attacks have left 4.5 million people without electricity.

64.title: Sequoia India hires former Uber exec Mohit Abraham as legal head
64.article_body: Sequoia Capital India and Southeast Asia has appointed Mohit Abraham as its Chief Legal Officer. Abraham was the former Legal Head at Uber Founder Travis Kalanick's startup CloudKitchens. Abraham has also been previously associated with Khaitan & Co and Uber. Siddharth V Rao, the incumbent General Counsel at Sequoia Capital India, will now lead data and transformation initiatives.

65.title: War in Ukraine is a frontal, shameless attack by Russia: German minister
65.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock has called Russian invasion of Ukraine a "frontal and shameless attack". After the Group of Seven nations wrapped up talks, Baerbock said, "We are counting every day of this brutal war of aggression...every day is one day too much." In an earlier issued joint statement, foreign ministers called upon Russia to "immediately stop" the war.

66.title: Student beaten, branded with iron box by 4 students in Andhra college hostel
66.article_body: At least four students of SRKR Engineering College in Andhra Pradesh's West Godavari were arrested for allegedly beating up another student with sticks and branding him with an iron box inside a hostel room, police said. A video surfaced online that shows the victim pleading to the accused. He was hospitalised with injuries all over his body, as per reports.

67.title: Kejriwal has turned Delhi into gas chamber: Bagga on pollution situation
67.article_body: BJP leader Tajinder Bagga said that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has turned Delhi into a gas chamber. "People are dying of pollution but he is on political tourism," he added. News agency ANI reported that Bagga also put up a poster comparing Kejriwal to Adolf Hitler outside the Delhi BJP headquarters.

68.title: Man trying to escape from monkeys falls from terrace, dies in UP
68.article_body: A 40-year-old man died after he reportedly accidentally fell from the terrace of his house while trying to escape from a troop of monkeys that attacked him in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly. The deceased was apparently sleeping on the terrace when the incident took place. The man's family claimed that he had suffered a severe head injury and fractured his legs.

69.title: Constant communal tension a violation of right to life: Supreme Court
69.article_body: The Supreme Court said that a constant atmosphere of communal tension is a violation of the constitutional right to life. SC was hearing a 21-year-old petition over the compensation to the families of victims of the 1992-93 Bombay riots and the revival of dormant criminal cases. "There was a failure on the part of the state government," SC stated.

70.title: Car drags bike for 1 km after hitting two men as sparks fly out in Ghaziabad
70.article_body: A video of road rage from Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad has surfaced on social media. The video shows a car driver dragging a bike for one kilometre after hitting two men. Sparks can be seen flying out as the man refuses to stop his car. The car driver has been arrested and the vehicle has been seized.

71.title: Hyderabad company to build Mongolia's first greenfield oil refinery
71.article_body: Megha Engineering & Infrastructures Limited (MEIL) has been given the responsibility to build Mongolia's first greenfield oil refinery on the outskirts of the capital city, Ulaanbaatar. A pipeline and a power plant are part of the refinery's operations. According to the officials, the refinery will generate employment opportunities and support the growth of nearby small industries.

72.title: NIIT acquires US-based St. Charles Consulting Group for ₹192 crore
72.article_body: Talent development company and managed training services provider NIIT said it acquired US-based St. Charles Consulting Group through its wholly-owned subsidiary, NIIT (USA) for $23.4 million (about ₹192 crore). St. Charles Consulting is headquartered in St Charles, Illinois and is a provider of consulting, design and implementation solutions for strategic learning programmes to services firms.

73.title: Pune man kills wife suspecting her character, tries to kill self
73.article_body: A 50-year-old man allegedly stabbed his wife to death and then attempted to die by suicide in Pune's Yerawada, police said. "The accused was suspicious about his wife's character and the couple used to always fight," a police official said. The police admitted the accused to a hospital after he apparently consumed a poisonous substance. The incident occurred on Tuesday.

74.title: 2 miners trapped in collapsed mine in S Korea rescued after 9 days
74.article_body: Two miners who were trapped in a collapsed zinc mine in eastern South Korea since October 26 were rescued on Friday. The survivors, aged 62 and 56, reportedly used an instant coffee mix powder they had with them as a meal. They "endured by drinking any water that dropped inside the shaft", a fire department official said.

75.title: Infosys to give 60% variable pay to select employees: Report
75.article_body: Infosys has mailed some of its staff announcing a 60% variable pay on average for certain levels of its business process management employees for the second quarter of the current fiscal, CNBC-TV18 reported. According to the mail, the pay was to be given out with October salaries. In the preceding quarter, the company had given 70% variable pay on average.

76.title: US to deploy B-1B bombers during joint drill with South Korea: Report
76.article_body: The US Air Force plans to deploy B-1B strategic bombers in joint military drill with South Korea, Yonhap News reported. This comes after North Korea carried out series of test launches. This is reportedly the first B-1B to be deployed in US-South Korean drill since 2017. South Korea urged US to step up deployment of aircraft carriers and nuclear submarines.

77.title: Owner of UP hospital where dengue patient died after platelet transfusion held
77.article_body: The owner of the private hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, where a dengue patient died after getting a platelet transfusion, has been arrested, police said on Saturday. Earlier it was alleged that the patient was given mosambi juice instead of platelets, however, an inquiry panel later concluded that the patient died due to the transfusion of "poorly-preserved" platelets.

78.title: ED arrests ex-BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari's son in money laundering case
78.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested gangster-turned-politician and former BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari's son, Abbas Ansari, in a money laundering case being investigated against his father and family, officials said. Abbas is a Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party MLA from Uttar Pradesh's Mau Sadar constituency. ED had attached seven immovable assets of Mukhtar Ansari worth ₹1.48 crore last month.

79.title: Govt helping youth get on the path of entrepreneurship: PM Modi
79.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that the central government is providing financial assistance to startups to set the youth on the path of entrepreneurship. While speaking at Rozgar Mela 2022 organised by the Government of Maharashtra, PM Modi said that the aim is to provide equal employment and entrepreneurship opportunities to Dalits, tribals and women.

80.title: Virat Kohli celebrates his birthday with teammates in Australia; BCCI shares video
80.article_body: Virat Kohli celebrated his 34th birthday with teammates in Australia, with BCCI sharing a video on Twitter. "Birthday celebrations on in Australia. Happy birthday Virat Kohli," BCCI wrote. Earlier, Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to share unseen pictures of Virat Kohli and wrote, "I chose your best angles."

81.title: Trash me all day, but Twitter blue tick will cost $8: Elon Musk
81.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk is defending his plan to charge $8 fee per month for blue tick on the microblogging site. "Trash me all day, but it'll cost $8," Musk said on Saturday amid criticism from several users, including celebrities over the verification fee. He earlier said Twitter is witnessing a "massive drop in revenue" amid advertisers pausing spending.

82.title: Himanshu Vyas resigns as AICC Secretary Incharge of Indian Overseas Cong
82.article_body: Congress leader Himanshu Vyas has resigned as the AICC Secretary Incharge of Indian Overseas Congress and from the party's primary membership. A copy of his resignation surfaced online. "Respected Shri Khargeji, I hereby resign as a secretary of AICC as in charge of Overseas Congress. I also resign from the party's primary membership," the resignation read.

83.title: He doesn't need a pep talk, he's charged up: Navya on brother's B'wood debut
83.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda said that she does not think her brother Agastya Nanda needs a pep talk for his Bollywood debut. "He is really motivated and I think he is out there to do really some great work, so I don't think he needs any pep talk from me, he is charged up already," she added.

84.title: Udaan fires 300-350 employees days after raising $120 mn: Reports
84.article_body: B2B unicorn Udaan has fired 300-350 employees to improve the company's efficiency and achieve profitability, reports said. This is the second round of layoffs this year as the company fired 180-200 employees in June. The latest round of layoffs comes days after the Lightspeed Venture Partners-backed firm raised $120 million in convertible notes and debt from existing shareholders and bondholders.

85.title: FIR against Rahul Gandhi after Congress uses KGF-2 songs in Bharat Jodo Yatra videos
85.article_body: MRT Music, which owns the rights to 'KGF: Chapter 2' songs in Hindi, filed a complaint against Rahul Gandhi and other Congress leaders for illegally using the songs in Bharat Jodo Yatra campaign videos. MRT Music said, the party is "violating the laws of the land and infringing our copyright and intellectual property rights". An FIR has been registered.

86.title: Fire breaks out in factory in Delhi's Narela; 2nd incident in a week
86.article_body: A fire broke out in a footwear factory in Delhi's Narela Industrial Area on Saturday, Delhi Fire Services (DFS) officials said. No casualties have been reported so far, DFS chief said. This is the second such incident reported from the area in a week after a fire that erupted at a factory on Tuesday left at least two people dead.

87.title: Delhi nurses to go on mass casual leave on November 16
87.article_body: Nurses in Delhi will go on mass casual leave on November 16, the Delhi Nurses Federation (DNF) on Friday said. If their demands are not met, they will start an indefinite strike from November 30, it added. The demands of nurses include regularisation of services, promotions that are long due and the creation of new posts.

88.title: Cannot fix all problems: UK PM Rishi Sunak amid economic crisis
88.article_body: Amid UK's ongoing economic crisis, British PM Rishi Sunak said the people cannot expect the state to "fix everyone's problems". However, Sunak said he recognised people's anxiety about soaring mortgage repayments and he would do "absolutely everything" he could to "grip this problem". Sunak, who's Britain's first Indian-origin Prime Minister, made these comments during an interview with The Times.

89.title: Twitter fires majority of its employees in India: Reports
89.article_body: Twitter has fired majority of its employees in India as part of mass layoffs that took place globally on Friday, as per reports. The company employed 200 to 300 employees in the country and the layoffs reportedly affected staff across engineering, sales and marketing, and communications teams. There was no clarity available on the severance package offered to fired staffers.

90.title: Forex reserves rise by $6.5 bn, highest weekly gain in over a year
90.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves surged by $6.56 billion to $531.08 billion in the week ended October 28, RBI data showed on Friday. This is the biggest weekly gain in the country's forex reserves in more than one year. The foreign currency assets rose by $5.77 billion to $470.84 billion and gold reserves increased by $556 million to $37.76 billion.

91.title: Apple to roll out 5G in iPhones for Indian users in beta mode next week
91.article_body: Apple will roll out 5G for iPhones in India starting next week to users enrolled in iOS 16 beta software programme. This will allow users on Airtel and Reliance Jio networks to access 5G in parts of India where it's enabled. This option will be available on 5G-enabled iPhone 14, iPhone 13, iPhone 12 and iPhone SE (3rd generation) models.

92.title: Blackberrys unveils its wedding campaign #FitForTheBigDay
92.article_body: Blackberrys launched its celebratory collection with the campaign 'Fit for the Big Day' aiming to enable men to look sharp. As India's leading menswear brand, it offers an exciting new range of western and ethnic wear and empowers men to reimagine their choices for weddings, festivities and celebrations, it said. Customers can book in-store appointments for a personalized experience.

93.title: Fraudsters impersonating as resort staff booked for cheating people in Mumbai
93.article_body: Mumbai Police booked fraudsters who linked their phone numbers to the Green Village Resort on Google Maps and siphoned off money from people. The fraudsters used to offer inexpensive deals to lure the callers into making online payments in advance. According to the resort manager, people have been cheated of various amounts ranging from ₹2,000 to ₹90,000.

94.title: Will name, shame advertisers if they continue to pull out of Twitter: Musk
94.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has said he will "name and shame" advertisers if they continue to pull out of Twitter. This comes after several advertisers paused paid advertising on the platform after Musk's $44 billion takeover. "Twitter has had a massive drop in revenue, due to activist groups pressuring advertisers...We did everything we could to appease...activists," Musk said earlier.

95.title: Bypolls in Odisha, Rajasthan, Bihar, UP and Chhattisgarh on Dec 5, result on Dec 8: EC
95.article_body: The Election Commission of India has announced the date for bypolls in Odisha, Rajasthan, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh and Chhattisgarh. The voting will take place on December 5 and the counting of votes will happen on December 8. The bypolls are scheduled in five Assembly constituencies, one each in Odisha, Rajasthan, Bihar, UP and Chhattisgarh and one Parliamentary constituency in UP.

96.title: Fired Twitter employee's 'Won't get to tweet it' tweet goes viral
96.article_body: A tweet by a Twitter employee after he was fired from the firm has gone viral on social media. "Won't get to tweet it, but here it is - the last @Twitter tweet from my team and I...thank you for the honor of a lifetime," he wrote. "Bye literally everyone," the pic shared by him read.

97.title: One of the world's largest spiders with 200 babies found in a car boot in Australia
97.article_body: A man in Australia found the nest of one of the world's largest spider species 'giant huntsman' guarding its egg sac in his car boot. The female huntsman produces a white egg sac of papery silk that carries around 200 babies. The car owner, who killed the spiders, said, "My initial response was revulsion."

98.title: Democracy, rule of law under threat in T'gana, country: Cong's Mallu Ravi
98.article_body: Congress leader Mallu Ravi criticised the BJP, TRS and said that democracy and the rule of law are under threat in Telangana and in the country. "In Telangana, 12 MLAs were taken from Congress to TRS, which is similar to the BJP taking MLAs from TRS. Now, KCR is feeling the heat and he is talking," said Ravi.

99.title: Tourists held by Peru indigenous group protesting oil spills freed
99.article_body: Members of an indigenous group on Friday freed over 100 tourists they held on a riverboat in the Peruvian Amazon a day earlier. The community took the "radical measure" to try to convince the government to assess the environmental damage from oil spills in the region, community leader Watson Trujillo said. The spills occurred in 2014 and September this year.

100.title: Situation of dengue in Lucknow is very pitiable: Allahabad HC
100.article_body: Allahabad High Court on Friday observed that the situation of dengue in Uttar Pradesh's capital city of Lucknow is "very pitiable" even as the state government's records said everything is "fine". The bench, which was hearing the state government's reply on a PIL over the matter, said that it would have checked the records if it had its own agency.

101.title: Pune City Police arrests 2 gangsters wanted in MCOCA case
101.article_body: Pune City Police has arrested two gangsters, Rupesh Marne and Santosh Shelar, both wanted in a Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA) case. This comes after police got information that Marne was meeting his wife, following which officials laid a trap and nabbed him on Thursday. Further interrogation revealed that Shelar was hiding at his native place in Botarwadi.

102.title: Parachute coconut oil maker Marico's Q2 profit dips by 3% to ₹301 cr
102.article_body: Marico Limited, the producer of Saffola cooking oil and Parachute coconut oil, posted a 3% year-on-year drop in its net profit at ₹301 crore for the September quarter. Its revenue from operations increased by 3% year-on-year to ₹2,496 crore with underlying volume growth of 3% in the domestic business and constant currency growth of 11% in the international business.

103.title: Don't see a major disadvantage in 5G rollout delay: Vodafone Idea
103.article_body: Vodafone Idea CEO Akshaya Moondra said he doesn't see a significant disadvantage for the company due to the delay in 5G rollout as the 5G handset market ecosystem has not started evolving. "The competition has already started...so we will be behind them," Moondra added. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel launched 5G services in some parts of the country last month.

104.title: BJP has spread garbage in Delhi, people will vote for cleanliness: Kejriwal
104.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal took to Twitter to urge the public of the national capital to "vote for cleanliness". "In the last 15 years, BJP has spread garbage all over Delhi...created mountains of garbage. This time, on December 4, people of Delhi will vote for cleanliness...they will vote for AAP," he said.

105.title: Pune's AeroMall may be opened to public in 10-15 days: Authorities
105.article_body: Pune airport authorities have said that the AeroMall may be opened to the public in the next 10 to 15 days. The facility had missed its inauguration deadline in October. However, Pune International Airport director Santosh Dhoke has said that the date of opening the facility has not been fixed as some "statutory requirements are going on".

106.title: Urge people to wear masks as Delhi CM is busy in Guj, Himachal: Mandaviya
106.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Friday urged people in Delhi to wear masks to protect themselves amid high pollution levels as the national capital's CM Arvind Kejriwal is "busy". "Kejriwal ji is busy talking about free 'rewadi' in Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh and putting up advertisements by spending crores of rupees of Delhi taxpayers' money," he claimed.

107.title: 4 dead, 4 injured as 2 cars meet with an accident on Yamuna Expressway
107.article_body: At least four persons were killed and four others were severely injured after two cars met with an accident on Yamuna Expressway. "The two cars met with an accident on Milestone 87 of Yamuna Expressway under Surir Police Station area in Mathura," police said. Local police reached the spot and the injured were taken to Mathura district hospital, police added.

108.title: HNIs tend to be long-term investors: Nykaa CEO as lock-in nears end
108.article_body: Nykaa CEO Falguni Nayar has said that high net-worth individuals (HNIs), many of whom hold stakes in the company, tend to be long-term investors. She said the company was unaware whether its pre-IPO investors would hold their stakes or sell. The statement comes before lock-in of ₹16.48 crore pre-IPO investor shares in Nykaa is set to expire on November 10.

109.title: 'Permacrisis' declared word of the year by Collins English Dictionary
109.article_body: The Collins English Dictionary has announced 'permacrisis' as the word of the year for 2022. The dictionary defines the word as "an extended period of instability and insecurity". According to Collins, the word "sums up quite succinctly how truly awful 2022 has been for so many people". Permacrisis is one of the six words that are new to the dictionary.

110.title: Biden criticises Musk's Twitter buy, says 'It spews lies around the world'
110.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday criticised Elon Musk for purchasing Twitter. "And now what are we all worried about? Elon Musk goes out and buys an outfit...that spews lies all across the world," he said during a fundraiser. "There's no editors anymore in America...How do we expect kids to be able to understand what is at stake?" he added.

111.title: Anushka shares unseen pics of Virat on his 34th birthday, says 'Chose your best angles'
111.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to share unseen pictures of her husband, cricketer Virat Kohli, on the occasion of his 34th birthday. She wrote, "It's your birthday my love, so obviously, I chose your best angles and photos for this post...Love you in every state and form and way." A fan commented, "Thank you for these pictures."

112.title: Need to assimilate technology for better treatment outcomes: Aarvy Healthcare's Dr Vikram
112.article_body: Aarvy Healthcare Super Speciality Hospital's Dr Vikram Singh, MS (General Surgery) said Indian healthcare ecosystem is rapidly expanding. "Need of the hour is to assimilate technology [for] better treatment outcomes," he stated. "At Aarvy we've implemented smart ICUs. The Mindray powered technology enables...specialists to monitor...patients' stats at the convenience of their handsets," he said.

113.title: India reacts after North Korea fires record number of missiles in a single day
113.article_body: India has reacted after North Korea fired 23 missiles on Wednesday, a record for a single day. "These launches constitute a violation of resolutions of Security Council relating to the DPRK. They affect the peace and security of the region and beyond," Ruchira Kamboj, India's Permanent Representative to UN said. "We also reiterate our continued support for denuclearisation," she added.

114.title: Mom refuses to see, says 'Don't want to watch all this': Abhishek on Breathe 2
114.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said that his actress-mother Jaya Bachchan refuses to watch 'Breathe 2'. "My mother refuses to watch it...She was like 'nahi mujhe ye sab nahi dekhna hai' (I do not want to watch all this), she gets scared...She doesn't like that kind of aggression and violence...So she prefers to go to parliament...where none of that happens," he said.

115.title: Climate activists throw pea soup at 1888 Van Gogh painting in Rome
115.article_body: A group of activists on Friday threw pea soup over a Vincent Van Gogh painting in Rome in a protest they warned will continue until more attention was paid to climate change. They also glued themselves to the wall below the 1888 painting 'The Sower'. Last month, climate activists threw tomato soup over Van Gogh's "Sunflowers" at London's National Gallery.

116.title: What is vestibular hypofunction, the condition Varun Dhawan has been diagnosed with?
116.article_body: Varun Dhawan said he was diagnosed with vestibular hypofunction, a condition in which the balance part of inner ear doesn't work properly. This can occur on one side (unilateral hypofunction) or on both sides of the head (bilateral hypofunction). It can lead to symptoms related to loss of normal balance reflexes, dizziness and postural instability, according to University of California.

117.title: 3 people returning from party die as car hits tree in MP, bodies retrieved
117.article_body: Three people were killed and one was injured after a car rammed into a tree near Bishanpura village in Niwari district in Madhya Pradesh. The incident took place on Friday. Police said the deceased and the injured were returning from a party. "It took six hours to retrieve the bodies from the vehicle using gas cutters," SDOP Santosh Patel said.

118.title: New Zealand man charged for exposing himself, urinating on plane floor
118.article_body: A 72-year-old New Zealand man on a flight from Bali to Brisbane admitted exposing himself and urinating on the floor of the aircraft while sitting in his seat as it began its descent. He has been charged with offensive behaviour. The man had drunk "a number of small bottles of wine" before the incident on November 2, police said.

119.title: Stone thrown at ex-Andhra CM Naidu's convoy; security officer hurt
119.article_body: A stone was hurled by unknown miscreants at the convoy of former Andhra Pradesh CM and Telugu Desam Party chief N Chandrababu Naidu in NTR District on Friday, the district's Police Commissioner said. In the incident, Naidu's Chief Security Officer (CSO), who was reportedly standing behind Naidu, was injured. An investigation is underway, the Police Commissioner added.

120.title: 7 blockchain startups join Mastercard's crypto accelerator programme
120.article_body: Mastercard has announced the addition of seven new blockchain startups to its engagement programme Mastercard Start Path. The aim of the move is to promote the adoption of crypto and blockchain technology. The seven startups are from US, Colombia, Singapore, Abu Dhabi and Dubai. The chosen companies will engage in bridging the gap between Web2 and Web3, the announcement mentioned.

121.title: I know I'm not most good-looking, wouldn't ever get hero's audition: Rajkummar
121.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said there was a time when he would never get to audition for the role of a hero. "I was told to audition for his friend's role. I know I'm not the most good-looking man in the room but Dibakar Banerjee [Filmmaker] saw something in me," he added. Rao was seen in Banerjee's 'Love, Sex Aur Dhokha'.

122.title: Mumbai roads will be cemented in next two years: Maha CM Shinde
122.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde announced that asphalt roads in Mumbai would be converted into concrete roads in the next two years. "Construction of quality roads is being done in Mumbai. The tender process has started. The BMC Commissioner has also been instructed to complete the concrete roads worth around ₹5,500 crore in two years," said Shinde.

123.title: Binance helped Iranian firms trade $8 bn despite US sanctions: Report
123.article_body: Iranian transactions with a value of $8 billion have been processed by Binance since 2018 despite US sanctions, blockchain data showed. Blockchain researcher Chainalysis found that around $7.8 billion moved between Binance and Iran's largest crypto exchange Nobitex. In a recently published blog, Binance said it told Iranian traders in 2018 that they could no longer use the services.

124.title: Hyderabad to get electric double-decker buses soon
124.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) will be introducing 10 electric double-decker buses soon in Hyderabad. "The electric buses would be acquired via [a] tender on rent...The fares and routes would be decided by TSRTC," said a senior official. The buses are likely to run on routes that are free of flyovers.

125.title: Ex-US pilot arrested in Aus has same address as Chinese hacker: Documents
125.article_body: An ex-US military pilot, who was arrested in Australia last month, listed the same Beijing address as a Chinese businessman jailed in the US for conspiring to hack US defence contractors' computers, documents showed. However, it's unclear whether they used the Beijing address at the same time. The pilot, Daniel Duggan, was arrested by Australian Federal Police at US' request.

126.title: RBI encouraged us to go for HDFC-HDFC Bank merger: Deepak Parekh
126.article_body: Amid the RBI tightening scrutiny on large NBFCs, HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said the central bank had encouraged HDFC and HDFC Bank to go for a merger. "We knew that they (guidelines) were going to be announced...RBI encouraged us that it is better if we merge...we had disadvantages of being an NBFC and no advantage of a bank," Parekh said.

127.title: HC fines woman ₹25,000 for wanting to add Musk to Twitter case, asks 'Are you serious?'
127.article_body: The Delhi High Court dismissed a plea seeking to implead Twitter's new owner Elon Musk as party to a petition challenging suspension of a user's account. Calling the application "thoroughly misconceived", the court imposed ₹25,000 cost on the woman petitioner. When Justice Yashwant Varma asked, "Are you serious?", the counsel argued that Musk is Twitter's sole director and its shareholder.

128.title: President Droupadi Murmu dances with Sikkim CM's wife; shares video
128.article_body: The official Twitter account of President of India shared a video showing President Droupadi Murmu dancing with Sikkim CM's wife. "President Droupadi Murmu along with Smt Krishna Rai...joined the members of a local dance troupe who performed the 'integration dance' at Gangtok in her honour. The dance captures the diversity, beauty and unity of Sikkim's culture," the caption read.

129.title: Medical education in Hindi also from next year in Uttarakhand: Minister
129.article_body: Medical courses in Uttarakhand will be taught in Hindi also, apart from English, from the next academic session, state Medical Education Minister Dhan Singh Rawat on Friday said. The state Medical Education Department has constituted a four-member expert committee, Rawat added. Uttarakhand will be the second state in the country to teach medical courses in Hindi also, after Madhya Pradesh.

130.title: Danish fintech startup Pleo to lay off 150 employees
130.article_body: Danish fintech startup Pleo will fire 150 employees. "We're no longer operating under 'growth first' mandate but rather a reality of 'growth through focus and efficiency'...what got us here, is not what will get us there," CEO Jeppe Rindom said. In 2021, Pleo raised $350 million and reached a $4.7 billion valuation, becoming one of Europe's most valued fintech firms.

131.title: Varun Dhawan reveals he was recently diagnosed with vestibular hypofunction
131.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has revealed that he was diagnosed with vestibular hypofunction, a disorder that affects the balance of an individual when the balance system in their inner ear isn't working properly. "Recently, I just shut down. I didn't know what had happened to me. I had this thing called vestibular hypofunction, (where) basically your balance goes off," he said.

132.title: 7 women labourers returning home after work killed as auto collides with truck in K'taka
132.article_body: As many as seven women labourers were killed after the auto-rickshaw that they were travelling in collided with a truck in a village in Chittaguppa taluk in Karnataka. The incident took place on Friday. Eleven people were injured in the incident. Reports said that the women were returning home after working when the accident took place.

133.title: United Airlines suspends ad spending on Twitter after Musk takeover
133.article_body: United Airlines Holdings has suspended ad spending on Twitter, a company spokesperson confirmed late on Friday. With this move, United Airlines has joined major brands such as Cheerios maker General Mills, luxury automaker Audi of America and General Motors to have paused advertising on Twitter, days after the social media platform was acquired by billionaire Elon Musk for $44 billion.

134.title: 50-year-old woman, 6-month-child injured in wall collapse in Pune
134.article_body: A 50-year-old woman and a six-month-old child were injured following a wall collapse at Masewali in Pune's Ganj Peth on Friday evening. The Pune Fire Brigade received the information at around 5.45 pm that the wall of an old house has collapsed. On reaching the spot, officials found that the walls of the ground and first floor had collapsed.

135.title: 32-yr-old man dies in UP Police custody, family alleges 3rd-degree torture
135.article_body: A 32-year-old man allegedly died in police custody in Uttar Pradesh. His family alleged third-degree torture at the hands of the police. The deceased's sister said that he was severely beaten up at the police station. The police, however, said that the man's health deteriorated when they took him for a medical examination and that he died there.

136.title: Rejected by girl, man abuses her, threatens to make her videos in Pune
136.article_body: A molestation case was registered against a 29-year-old man for allegedly abusing a girl. The girl had rejected him after he had proposed to her online, reports said. Following this, the man had allegedly abused her and had threatened to make her videos and defame her in college. The incident took place on November 1.

137.title: ₹20,000 fine for violation of ban on vehicles amid Delhi pollution: Official
137.article_body: Violation of the ban on plying of certain vehicles to curb Delhi's air pollution will attract a fine of ₹20,000, an official said. This comes after the Delhi government banned the entry of trucks other than electric and CNG, except those carrying essential commodities. Four-wheeled diesel light motor vehicles, except BS-VI vehicles, have also been banned.

138.title: Independent India's 1st voter Shyam Saran Negi passes away aged 106
138.article_body: Independent India's first voter Shyam Saran Negi passed away at the age of 106. Negi, a resident of Himachal Pradesh's Kinnaur, cast his postal ballot on November 2 for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Deputy Commissioner of Kinnaur Abid Hussain Sadiq said, "We will go to his home and perform last rites with full honour."

139.title: Let's look at India, talented & very driven people: Putin as he praises India
139.article_body: On Russia's Unity Day on Friday, the country's President Vladimir Putin praised India, saying, "Let's look at India: talented, very driven people with such a drive for internal development." Adding that India will achieve outstanding results in terms of development, Putin stated, "Almost one-and-a-half billion people. Now that's potential."

140.title: Bike hits railing at Delhi's Signature Bridge; 1 dead, 2 injured
140.article_body: A 20-year-old man was killed while his brother and neighbour were injured after the motorcycle they were travelling on crashed into the concrete railing at Delhi's Signature Bridge. The police received information at 5.50 am that the trio was brought to a hospital after the accident, the DCP (North) said. An FIR has been filed in the matter.

141.title: Finnish PM Sanna Marin cleared of misconduct over party video
141.article_body: Finnish PM Sanna Marin has been cleared of misconduct after a video in August showed her partying with her friends. Dozens of complaints were reportedly filed, alleging her behaviour undermined Finland's "reputation and security". But, Chancellor of Justice Tuomas Pöysti concluded that Marin hadn't neglected her duties as PM. Marin took a drug test after the footage went viral online.

142.title: Twitter lays off 50% of its employees company-wide
142.article_body: Twitter has laid off 50% of its employees company-wide, its Safety and Integrity Head Yoel Roth confirmed. The platform's front-line content moderation staff experienced the least impact, said Roth. Staff in engineering, communications, product, content curation and machine learning ethics were among those impacted by the layoffs. The company's entire human rights team was also cut.

143.title: Mahanagar Gas hikes CNG, PNG prices, auto gas rate up by ₹3.5/kg
143.article_body: The Mahanagar Gas Limited (MGL) has revised the prices of piped natural gas (PNG) and compressed natural gas (CNG) as it raised the auto gas price by ₹3.5/kg. The piped cooking gas price has been hiked by ₹1.5/standard cubic metre from Saturday midnight in Mumbai and adjoining areas. CNG price in Mumbai is ₹86/kg and the PNG price is ₹24.65/kg.

144.title: 18-year-old boy dies after bus rams into bike at Pune's Katraj Ghat
144.article_body: An 18-year-old boy was killed and another person was injured after a bus coming from the opposite direction rammed into the bike the duo was travelling on at Pune's Katraj Ghat on Friday, according to the police. Senior officials from a police station had rushed to the spot. "We have lodged...complaint," a senior inspector at the police station said.

145.title: No choice when Twitter is losing over $4 million per day: Elon Musk on layoffs
145.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said there was no choice other than to reduce Twitter's workforce as the company is losing more than $4 million per day. The company fired 50% of its workforce on Friday, a week after Musk took over control. "Everyone exited was offered 3 months of severance, which is 50% more than legally required," he said.

146.title: Volkswagen asks its brands to halt paid advertising on Twitter
146.article_body: The Volkswagen Group has asked its brands, which include Volkswagen, Seat, Cupra, Audi, Lamborghini, Bentley, Ducati and Porsche, to pause paid advertising on Twitter. This comes after several brands paused paid advertising on the platform following Elon Musk's takeover. "We are closely monitoring the situation and will decide about next steps depending on its evolvement," Volkswagen said.

147.title: Schumacher’s 2003 title-winning Ferrari could fetch ₹77 crore: Sotheby’s
147.article_body: Seven-time F1 world champion Michael Schumacher's 2003 championship-winning Ferrari car is being auctioned next week in Geneva. The red "Chassis 229" Ferrari raced by Schumacher nine times could reportedly fetch up to $9.4 million (₹77.16 crore). "It's...special because this car is one of the only four cars with more than four wins in Ferrari history," said auction house Sotheby's.

148.title: US announces new military aid for Ukraine worth $400 million
148.article_body: The US on Friday announced its latest military assistance package for Ukraine worth $400 million. The package will include the US paying for the refurbishment of 45 T-72 tanks from the Czech Republic for use by Kyiv, Pentagon spokeswoman Sabrina Singh told reporters. Pentagon said the US would also fund the refurbishment of some HAWK air defence missiles.

149.title: He was upset at not being selected in India's T20 WC squad: Shami's coach
149.article_body: Mohammad Shami's coach Mohammad Badruddin revealed that the India pacer was angry at not being selected for T20 World Cup. "Those pitches suit his bowling. He was upset when the selection didn't happen but never showed it...it [was] my gut feeling that he would play," said Badruddin. Shami was brought in as a replacement after Jasprit Bumrah was ruled out.

150.title: Tokyo Olympics bronze changed Indian hockey's face: Defender Rohidas
150.article_body: India defender Amit Rohidas said the team's historic bronze medal-winning feat at the Tokyo Olympics has changed the face of hockey in the country. "Youngsters who didn't play hockey earlier have now taken to the sport in the villages...it makes me feel very good," said Rohidas. He added that kids are eagerly waiting for the 2023 FIH men's World Cup.

151.title: Well thought out conspiracy: Pak leader on attack on Imran Khan
151.article_body: Senior leader of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party Fawad Chaudhry on Friday said the assassination attempt on party chief Imran Khan was "a prelude to a well-thought-out conspiracy". Chaudhry alleged three senior officials in Pakistan's federal government, Shehbaz Sharif, Rana Sanaullah and Major General Faisal Naseer, were "masterminds" of the attack on the former prime minister.

152.title: It's been a long time, can't wait to perform in India: WWE's Bayley
152.article_body: WWE wrestler Bayley said she can't wait for WWE to come back to India. "I know it's been a really long time and I always see their posts...I appreciate your guys' support and I can't wait to come perform for you one day," said Bayley. She will next be competing in a WWE Crown Jewel Championship match against Bianca Belair.

153.title: Iran commemorates 1979 US Embassy takeover
153.article_body: Iran on Friday commemorated the 1979 takeover of the American Embassy in Tehran. State-run television showed people in the capital waving placards with anti-American slogans and some waving triangle-shaped miniature drone-replicas, which suggested the use of Iranian drones by Russia in the Ukraine war. The commemorations were held as anti-government protests continued in parts of the country.

154.title: Britannia's Q2 net profit rises 28% YoY to ₹490 cr, revenue jumps 21%
154.article_body: FMCG major Britannia Industries reported a 28% year-over-year growth in consolidated net profit at ₹490.58 crore for the quarter ended September 2022. During the same quarter last fiscal, net profit stood at ₹381.8 crore. The company's revenue from operations jumped 21% year-over-year to ₹4,379.61 crore from ₹3,607.37 crore. Britannia's direct distribution jumped to 26 lakh outlets.

155.title: Civilians should be evacuated from conflict zones: Russian Prez
155.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said civilians should be evacuated from conflict areas in Kherson. On the occasion of Russia's Day of National Unity, Putin said the civilian population should not suffer. Kherson is one of the four Ukrainian provinces that Russia annexed in September. Putin added 3,18,000 people were drafted into the Army after the mobilisation exercise began.

156.title: Face ED, don't play tribal card: BJP leader to Jharkhand CM Soren
156.article_body: Senior BJP leader Babulal Marandi said that Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren should face the investigation by the Enforcement Directorate instead of playing the tribal card. "If PM Narendra Modi can face SIT questioning while being the Gujarat CM, why can't CM Soren?" Marandi asked. Notably, ED had summoned CM Soren in a money laundering case linked to alleged illegal mining.

157.title: What different do we get from other teams? Roger Binny on claims that ICC favours India
157.article_body: BCCI President Roger Binny has responded to claims that ICC favours India. "Not fair. I don't think we are favoured by ICC. Everyone gets same treatment," he said. "What different do we get from other teams? India is a big powerhouse in cricket but we are all treated the same," he added.

158.title: Delhi court grants interim bail to Sushil Kumar till November 12 due to wife's health
158.article_body: A Delhi court on Friday granted interim bail to two-time Olympic medallist Sushil Kumar, who's the main accused in the murder of wrestler Sagar Dhankar, till November 12. Kumar was granted interim bail due to the medical condition of his wife and two minor children, the court said. The court asked Sushil to furnish a personal bond of ₹1 lakh.

159.title: Thank you from Imran Khan's sons: Ex-Pak PM's ex-wife to man who tackled his attacker
159.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's ex-wife Jemima Goldsmith took to Twitter to react to the news of Imran being shot at during a rally. "The news we dread...Thank God he's okay. And thank you from his sons to the heroic man in the crowd who tackled the gunman," she wrote. A man named Ibtesaam reportedly caught the attacker.

160.title: Bail plea of businessman accused in Andaman rape case rejected
160.article_body: The Calcutta High Court (HC) on Friday dismissed the anticipatory bail application of Sandeep Singh, who is an accused in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands gang rape case in which top officials were named. Further, the police issued a lookout notice against the Port Blair-based businessman. The police earlier announced a reward of ₹1 lakh for information to arrest Singh.

161.title: China’s Xi calls for Russia-Ukraine peace talks
161.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday called for peace negotiations between Russia and Ukraine, as he warned of the possibility of a nuclear conflict. Xi made the comments as he interacted with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, who is on a one-day state visit to Beijing. "As influential powers, China and Germany should work together in times of change," Xi said.

162.title: I would be very excited to see India playing in FIFA World Cup: Cafu
162.article_body: Former Brazilian footballer Cafu said that he would be very excited to see India playing in the FIFA World Cup. "Since I have come to India now, I wish India get to play in WC," Cafu said. During his India visit, the Brazilian ex-footballer will feature in an 'All Star' exhibition match along with Indian tennis legend Leander Paes.

163.title: SC denies relief to accused in Telangana MLAs poaching case
163.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday denied interim relief to the three arrested persons who allegedly tried to poach Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) legislators. On October 26, police registered an FIR against three persons for allegedly trying to lure four BRS legislators into defecting. The BRS has claimed that the arrested persons were working at the behest of the BJP.

164.title: 3 Military Engineer Services officials arrested in bribery case
164.article_body: Three officials working at the Military Engineer Services in Bhopal were arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹1.10 lakh. The accused were identified as Junior Administrative Assistant Arun Singh, Assistant Garrison Engineers JJ Kennedy and RS Yadav. The CBI said during searches at the residences of the arrested incriminating documents were found.

165.title: MS Dhoni moves Madras High Court for contempt proceedings against IPS officer
165.article_body: Ex-India captain MS Dhoni has moved Madras High Court to initiate contempt proceedings against IPS officer G Sampath Kumar for his alleged statements against Supreme Court and certain senior counsels. In his plea, Dhoni said Sampath had made the "defamatory remarks" in his written submissions in a case pertaining to IPL 2013 spot-fixing scandal. Sampath had investigated the scandal.

166.title: Forest official injured in crocodile attack during rescue op in UP
166.article_body: A forest official was injured when a crocodile attacked a team of forest officers carrying out an operation to rescue the reptile in UP's Sitapur. The crocodile bit the official's hand, District Forest Officer Mohan Shukla informed. Shukla said they had received information about a crocodile coming out of a lake, following which they reached the spot.

167.title: Probe agency has no right to ask accused for passwords: Delhi court
167.article_body: A Delhi court has ruled that an accused cannot be compelled by an investigation agency to share the password of his electronic devices. "Not only does an accused person has the right to refuse to answer...there is also a rule against adverse inferences being drawn," said the judge. The CBI had filed a case seeking the password of an accused.

168.title: Don't let people below 21 yrs buy liquor: Bilaspur SP to shop operators
168.article_body: Bilaspur Superintendent of Police (SP) Parul Mathur has asked liquor shop operators in the district to not sell liquors to people below 21 years of age and also prohibit their entry to bar shops. In a letter to the operators, Mathur said the shops should be opened after 12 pm and should be closed by 12 am at any cost.

169.title: 2nd airport near Chennai is 'need of the hour': Tamil Nadu govt
169.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government said on Friday that the proposed ₹20,000-crore airport at Parandur near Chennai would help the state achieve its '$1-trillion economy' target. The government said the second airport near Chennai was the "need of the hour", as there was congestion in the Meenambakkam airport. It added that cargo transactions were being shifted to Bengaluru and Hyderabad airports.

170.title: RIL appoints KV Kamath as independent director for 5 years
170.article_body: Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) on Friday appointed veteran banker KV Kamath as an independent director on the company board for a period of five years. Further, Kamath was also appointed as non-executive chairman of Reliance Strategic Investments Limited (RSIL), a wholly owned subsidiary of RIL. RSIL will be renamed as Jio Financial Services Limited (JFSL), the board announced.

171.title: Brazil are no more dependent on Neymar: Ex-player Cafu
171.article_body: Ex-footballer Cafu said that the Brazilian national team are no more dependent on forward Neymar, especially for the upcoming FIFA World Cup in Qatar. "Now Brazil isn't dependent...because there are several players like Vinicius Junior, Rodrygo, Richarlison and Lucas Paqueta...Those players are also capable of winning the cup...but four years ago, it was all Neymar," Cafu said.

172.title: Dogecoin falls 10% amid reports of Twitter pausing crypto wallet plans
172.article_body: Dogecoin's value recently dropped around 10% amid reports that Twitter is pausing its crypto wallet plans. "A recently revealed plan to build a crypto wallet for Twitter appears to be on pause," a report by Platformer revealed. Notably, the meme-based cryptocurrency's value nearly doubled after billionaire Elon Musk acquired Twitter last week.

173.title: Sudhir Suri's assailant runs garment shop, shot him with licensed revolver: Punjab DGP
173.article_body: Sandeep Singh, the assailant of Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri, runs a garment shop right in front of the site, where Suri was protesting with other Sena leaders, Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav, said. A scuffle broke out between them when he asked the leaders to stop the demonstration, following which he shot at Suri with his licensed gun, Yadav added.

174.title: Spent long time being secondary to men, now women need to have agency: Priyanka
