Inconvenience caused is deeply regretted," Western Railway's Mumbai division tweeted.

348.title: Pak police officers suspended for leaking confession of Imran Khan's attacker
348.article_body: Chief Minister of Pakistan's Punjab province Chaudhry Elahi has suspended police officers and other officials for leaking the confession of the suspect who shot at ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan during a rally in Wazirabad. In a confession video, the suspect can be heard saying he "wanted to kill only Imran Khan and no one else" because "he was misleading people".

349.title: Man kicks 6-yr-old in the chest for leaning on his car in Kerala; arrested
349.article_body: A man has been arrested after a video showing him kicking a six-year-old boy in the chest for leaning on his car went viral on social media. Police has registered a case against the man, Shihshad, a resident of Ponnyampalam. Assembly Speaker AN Shamseer said stringent action would be taken against the accused.

350.title: Ireland's Josh Little breaks world record for taking most T20I wickets in a single year
350.article_body: Ireland's 23-year-old fast bowler Josh Little has broken the world record for taking most wickets in T20I cricket in a calendar year. With his hat-trick against New Zealand in T20 World Cup 2022 on Friday, Little took his tally of wickets in T20I cricket in 2022 to 39. He overtook Nepal's Sandeep Lamichhane, who has taken 38 wickets in 2022.

351.title: Reliance in talks to buy 49% stake in Naturals Salon & Spa: Report
351.article_body: The retail arm of Reliance Industries, Reliance Retail, is looking to enter the salon business by buying a 49% stake in the Chennai-based Groom India Salon & Spa, the Naturals Salon & Spa parent, The Economic Times reported citing sources. Confirming the development, CEO of Naturals Salon & Spa CK Kumaravel said that the negotiations are at a 'nascent stage'.

352.title: Delhi primary schools to be shut from tomorrow amid high pollution levels
352.article_body: Primary schools in Delhi will remain shut from tomorrow amid high pollution levels in the national capital, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced on Friday. Schools will remain closed till pollution situation in national capital improves. Schools in Noida and Greater Noida also decided to hold online classes for students of Classes 1-8 till November 8 in view of rising pollution.

353.title: Ireland become first team to produce 2 hat-tricks in T20 World Cup history
353.article_body: Ireland have became the first team to produce two hat-tricks in T20 World Cup history. Ireland's 23-year-old pacer Josh Little dismissed New Zealand's Kane Williamson, Jimmy Neesham and Mitchell Santner on Friday to take Ireland's second hat-trick in T20 World Cup history. Curtis Campher was the first Irish bowler to take a T20 World Cup hat-trick.

354.title: Apple starts manufacturing iPhone 14 at a second plant in India: Report
354.article_body: Apple's Taiwanese contract manufacturer Pegatron has begun assembling the new iPhone 14 in India, Bloomberg reported. The move makes Pegatron the second Apple supplier to manufacture the iPhone 14 in India, months after Foxconn started its production near Chennai. Notably, the world's largest iPhone plant situated in China's Zhengzhou was recently placed under lockdown after COVID-19 outbreak.

355.title: Sushmita Sen told me if I'm happy without Rajeev, I should separate: Sister-in-law Charu
355.article_body: After initiating divorce proceedings again against Rajeev Sen, actress Charu Asopa said that her sister-in-law Sushmita Sen has always told her to prioritise her own happiness. "She (Sushmita) has said that if I'm happier with Rajeev, then that's what I should do, but if I'm happier away from him, then I should separate," Charu said.

356.title: Apple halts hiring for roles outside R&D to cut costs: Report
356.article_body: Apple has paused hiring for several jobs outside of research and development under its plan to cut costs, Bloomberg reported. It made the decision to freeze hiring last month ahead of its quarterly earnings report. Apple said it continues to hire but given the current economic environment it's taking "a very deliberate approach" in some parts of the business.

357.title: Morbi Nagar Palika chief officer suspended over bridge collapse: Reports
357.article_body: The chief officer of Gujarat's Morbi Nagar Palika Sandipsinh Zala has reportedly been suspended following the Morbi bridge collapse incident that killed 135 persons. Police have arrested nine persons in connection with the incident so far. An Oreva Group manager, Deepak Parekh, who is among those arrested earlier said it was "the will of God" that the incident took place.

358.title: 6 health workers terminated after dog licks blood of patient in UP hospital
358.article_body: Services of six health workers were terminated after a video of a dog licking the blood of a patient in a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Kushinagar went viral. Reports said that Kushinagar district magistrate, S Raj Lingam, issued the termination orders. Lingam also sought an explanation from the chief medical superintendent and two medical officers.

359.title: 5-day search operation after Morbi suspension bridge collapse called off
359.article_body: The Gujarat government has called off the five-day search operation that was launched after the collapse of the suspension bridge in Gujarat's Morbi. More than 130 people lost their lives in the incident. State Commissioner of Relief Harshad Patel visited Morbi and announced the end of the search operation, reports said.

360.title: Morgan Stanley to begin layoffs in coming weeks globally: Report
360.article_body: Morgan Stanley is expected to begin a fresh round of layoffs globally in coming weeks, Reuters reported citing people familiar with the plan. In Asia Pacific, the bank has reportedly drafted a list of staff members considered redundant, who mainly work with teams that focus on China-related business. The bank is yet to decide on scale and timing of layoffs.

361.title: When India play, there is a lot of pressure on ICC: Afridi on India-Bangladesh match
361.article_body: Talking about rain-curtailed India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup 2022 match, former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi stated that there is a lot of pressure on ICC when India play. "Given the amount of rain that happened, the game resumed immediately after the break...India's pressure on ICC is evident," Afridi stated. "There are many factors involved," Afridi further said.

362.title: US embassy officials visit basketball player Griner in Russian prison
362.article_body: Officials from the US embassy in Moscow met detained US basketball player Brittney Griner on Thursday. The officials "saw firsthand her tenacity and perseverance despite her present circumstances", US State Department spokesman Ned Price said, adding that US would continue to push for her release. Last week, a Russian court rejected Griner's appeal of her nine-year sentence for drug possession.

363.title: Nuclear attack on US will result in end of Kim Jong-un's regime: US
363.article_body: After repeated missile launches by North Korea, US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said, "Any nuclear attack against the United States or its allies and partners, including the use of non-strategic nuclear weapons, is unacceptable." "It will result in the end of the Kim regime," he further said. North Korea launched over 20 missiles on Wednesday.

364.title: Are we thieves, murderers; don't we have engagements: Soren on ED summons
364.article_body: While speaking about the summons issued to him by the Enforcement Directorate, Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren asked, "Do you think we are 'chor-uchakke' (thieves) or 'hatyare' (murderers)? They issued the summons yesterday (Wednesday) and asked me to appear today (Thursday)." "Don't we have our engagements?" he further asked while saying that he was already invited to an event.

365.title: Twitter down for several users in India
365.article_body: Twitter was down for several users in India on Friday morning, with many reporting that they were unable to log into the website. A popup saying, "Something went wrong, but don't worry-try again", was shown to users trying to access the site. Notably, the outage was reported hours after news broke that Twitter will start laying off staff today.

366.title: Cong promises up to 300 units of free electricity ahead of Gujarat polls
366.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat polls, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge announced 10 promises, including subsidised or free services in the health care, farm and electricity sectors. "LPG cylinders for ₹500, free electricity for up to 300 units, free treatment and medicines up to ₹10 lakh, loan waivers for up to ₹3 lakh for farmers," said Kharge.

367.title: Amazon pauses hiring in corporate workforce for the next few months
367.article_body: Amazon is pausing corporate workforce hiring as the e-commerce firm deals with an "unusual macro-economic environment", Beth Galetti, Senior Vice-president of People Experience and Technology, said. "We anticipate keeping this pause in place for the next few months...will continue to monitor what we're seeing in the economy and the business to adjust as we think makes sense," she added.

368.title: French Parliament suspended as MP shouts 'Go back to Africa' at black MP
368.article_body: France's lower house of Parliament was suspended on Thursday after a far-right MP shouted, "Go back to Africa!" as a Black legislator talked about immigration. Grégoire de Fournas later said his remark wasn't aimed at MP Carlos Bilongo but at migrants trying to reach Europe by sea. "There's no room for racism in our democracy," French PM Elisabeth Borne said.

369.title: 22,500-kg part of Chinese rocket, the size of 10-storey building, likely to crash on Earth
369.article_body: A 22,500-kg part of China's Long March 5B rocket is expected to crash on Earth either on Friday or Saturday, with uncertainty about where exactly it will land, according to the Aerospace Corporation. The part is said to be about the size of a 10-storey building. "The uncertainty of where the large debris will ultimately land presents...risk," it stated.

370.title: Woman, daughter among 3 dead as car falls into well in Maharashtra
370.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her eight-year-old daughter were among the three persons who died as their car fell into an old open well in Maharashtra's Buldhana, police said. The woman was driving and her husband and their daughter were with her, police added. He managed to come out safely and another man who tried to rescue them died, police stated.

371.title: Platform ticket prices reduced from ₹50 to ₹10 by Northern Railway
371.article_body: Northern Railway has rolled back the platform ticket prices that were increased to ₹50 due to Diwali and Chhath Puja. The platform ticket will now be available for ₹10, as before. "The rates of platform tickets at a total of 14 railway stations have been reduced…Tickets became cheaper at Lucknow, Varanasi, Barabanki, Ayodhya Cantt…Unnao," said the DCM of Northern Railway.

372.title: Ex-Andhra minister, son arrested for allegedly forging document
372.article_body: Former Andhra Pradesh minister and Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader Ayyanna Patrudu and his son were arrested for allegedly forging a document, which was submitted to the High Court, related to encroachment of an irrigation canal land. Patrudu and his son were arrested from their residence in Narsipatnam. Patrudu's wife criticised the government for arresting the duo without prior information.

373.title: US-based Apiiro raises $100 mn in a round led by General Catalyst
373.article_body: US-based applications security startup Apiiro has secured $100 million in Series B funding round led by General Catalyst. The round saw participation from Greylock and Kleiner Perkins. The funding comes weeks after Globes reported that cybersecurity firm Palo Alto Networks was interested in buying Apiiro for around $550 million. In October 2020, Apiiro raised $35 million in Series A round.

374.title: Mumbai local train bumps into buffer while stopping at station, probe on
374.article_body: A local train in Mumbai bumped into a buffer while coming to halt at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) on Thursday. Reports said that no injury was reported in the incident. A Central Railway official said that an inquiry into the matter has been initiated to ascertain the exact cause of the incident.

375.title: Elon Musk removes 'Days of Rest' from Twitter employees' calendars: Reports
375.article_body: Elon Musk has removed 'Days of Rest' from Twitter employees' calendars for the rest of the year, as per reports. The monthly, company-wide day off was introduced at Twitter during the COVID-19 pandemic period to help reduce burnout. Meanwhile, Musk is reportedly planning to end the work from anywhere policy for Twitter staff who will not be affected by layoffs.

376.title: Balewadi residents launch campaign against Pune Smart City
376.article_body: A residency cooperative housing federation in Pune's Balewadi has launched a campaign against Pune Smart City Development Corporation Limited (PSCDCL) for being deprived of basic citizens' rights like water, roads, etc. "We're willing to hold a meeting with the residents...but we have...implemented projects such as...Balewadi road redesign...and LED street lights," PSCDCL CEO said.

377.title: Fire at warehouse in Pune as 10 LPG cylinders explode, no casualties
377.article_body: A major fire broke out at a private warehouse, full of plastic material and other scrap items, as about 10 LPG cylinders exploded in Vadgaonsheri's Sopan Nagar on the Pune-Ahmednagar Highway on Thursday. No casualties were reported in the incident. As many as 15 fire tenders along with eight fire officers and 60 firemen were rushed to the site.

378.title: India comments on Elon Musk's plan to charge $8/month for Twitter blue tick
378.article_body: Commenting on Elon Musk's plan to charge $8 per month for Twitter blue tick, Ministry of External Affairs' Official Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "We are not aware of the process of paid subscription." "We will take a decision based on the contours of this subscription service as and when it happens," he further said.

379.title: Twitter fired me after I made software to save emails, shared it with others: Engineer
379.article_body: A former Twitter engineer claimed that he was fired after he made a browser extension that helped download important emails and documents and shared it with his colleagues amid rumours about layoffs at the company. "My current understanding is...I was too much of a potential troublemaker for the new management," Emmanuel Cornet said speculating his reasons for being laid off.

380.title: Cheerios maker, Audi of America halt ads on Twitter after Musk takeover
380.article_body: After General Motors, Cheerios maker General Mills and luxury automaker Audi of America have paused advertising on Twitter following Tesla CEO Elon Musk taking over the social media company last week. "We will continue to monitor this new direction and evaluate our marketing spend," a General Mills spokesperson said. Audi of America said it would "continue to evaluate the situation".

381.title: 65% of Indian companies employed gig workers in 2022: Report
381.article_body: Almost 65% of Indian companies employed gig workers in 2022, a report by trade body NASSCOM, job portal Indeed and financial services firm AON showed. The report mentioned that share of companies (with more than 2,000 full-time employees) hiring gig workers has increased, but their proportion remains less than 5% of total workforce. In 2020, 57% companies employed gig workers.

382.title: Gangster Ejaz Lakdawala takes bottle of mosquitoes to Mumbai court to seek nets in jail
382.article_body: Gangster Ejaz Lakdawala, who is an undertrial at Taloja Central Jail, arrived at the Mumbai sessions court with a bottle filled with mosquitoes to seek access to mosquito nets. However, his plea was rejected as prison officials raised the issue of security, stating that nails and strings used for setting up the mosquito nets could pose safety concerns.

383.title: Cab driver beaten up in Delhi then left tied up in Gurugram; 4 held
383.article_body: Four people were arrested after a cab driver was allegedly beaten up and robbed in Delhi and then left tied up with a blindfold in Gurugram's Manesar. The accused had apparently hailed the victim's cab. "At Zakhira flyover, one of the accused got down on...pretext of urinating. The others tried to strangle...driver and pushed him in...back seat," an officer said.

384.title: 4.5 mn left without electricity after Russia's attacks: Ukraine Prez
384.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said about 4.5 million people have been temporarily left without electricity due to Russian attacks. "The very fact that Russia resorted to terror against the energy industry shows the weakness of the enemy. They cannot defeat Ukraine on the battlefield, and that's why they're trying to break our people in this way," he added.

385.title: Tiger Global halts new investments in Chinese equities: Report
385.article_body: Tiger Global Management has halted investments in Chinese equities even as it reassesses its exposure to the country after President Xi Jinping entered into his third term of power, The Wall Street Journal reported. The executives of the investment firm have reportedly said that geopolitical tensions could increase after Xi's re-election and China's zero-COVID-19 policy is likely to continue.

386.title: What will be affected as Delhi implements stage 4 of pollution action plan?
386.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management has decided to implement measures under stage 4 of Graded Response Action Plan in Delhi-NCR. Under this, the entry of trucks other than electric and CNG, except those carrying essential commodities, will be banned. Four-wheeled diesel light motor vehicles, except BS-VI vehicles, will be banned. The construction work will also be restricted in Delhi-NCR.

387.title: 11 people killed as bus collides with car in Madhya Pradesh's Betul
387.article_body: As many as 11 people were killed in Madhya Pradesh's Betul after a bus collided with a car. The accident took place near the Jhallar police station. One person who was injured in the accident has been admitted to a hospital, SP Betul Simala Prasad told news agency ANI. A picture from accident site showed damaged car on the road.

388.title: Former Israel PM Netanyahu wins general election; PM Modi congratulates him
388.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday congratulated former Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu for his win in the general election. "Congratulations my friend Netanyahu on your success...I look forward to continuing our joint efforts to deepen the strategic partnership between India and Israel," PM Modi tweeted. This was Israel's fifth general election in less than four years.

389.title: 3 K'taka sisters enter lake to save their 14-yr-old brother, all 4 drown
389.article_body: Three sisters drowned while trying to save their 14-year-old brother from drowning in a lake in Vijayanagara district of Karnataka. The incident took place on Wednesday. The deceased have been identified as 17-year-old Ashwini, 14-year-old Abhishek, 19-year-old Kavya and 14-year-old Apoorva. Abhishek had fallen into the lake accidentally. His elder sister then jumped into the lake to save him.

390.title: Delhi's air quality 'severe' with 472 AQI; Noida's AQI at 562
390.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Friday morning was recorded as 'severe' with an air quality index (AQI) of 472. The AQI in Uttar Pradesh's Noida also stood in the 'severe' category at 562, while in Gurugram it stood at 539. An AQI of 563 was recorded on Friday morning near the Delhi University area.

391.title: Violence has no place in politics: US on Imran Khan assassination attempt
391.article_body: The US condemned the assassination attempt on ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan during a rally in Wazirabad. "Violence has no place in politics, and we call on all parties to refrain from violence...and intimidation," US State Secretary Antony Blinken said. The suspect who shot at Khan confessed that he wanted to "kill" the former premier "because he was misleading people".

392.title: If you are on your way to office, please go home: Twitter tells staff amid layoffs
392.article_body: Twitter will start laying off employees on Friday, a week after Elon Musk acquired the company. "If you are in an office or on your way to an office, please return home," Twitter wrote in an email to its staff. Employees who are being laid off will be notified with the next steps on their personal email accounts, Twitter said.

393.title: Layoffs to start on Friday: Twitter in email to staff
393.article_body: Twitter will alert employees on Friday about whether they will be laid off, the company said in an email to staff. The social media platform said in the email that its offices will be temporarily closed and all badge access will be suspended in order "to help ensure safety of each employee as well as Twitter systems and customer data".

394.title: 1-day old baby among 487 kids rescued under 'Operation Reunite' in Mumbai
394.article_body: The Mumbai Police have rescued 487 missing or abducted children in 45 days, from August 15 to September 30, under 'Operation Reunite'. Among those rescued are a one-day-old baby and a one-year-old girl. Out of the total, 257 girls and 230 boys have been rescued, Commissioner of Police (CP) Vivek Phansalkar, who had launched the operation, said.

395.title: Musk directs Twitter to cut infrastructure costs by $1 bn: Report
395.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has ordered teams at Twitter to find up to $1 billion in annual infrastructure cost savings, Reuters reported citing sources and an internal Slack message. The teams have a November 7 deadline to present their cost savings plans. Some employees have been ordered to work in the office throughout the week to meet the deadline.

396.title: Mumbai's Gokhale bridge declared unsafe, may be shut for traffic from Mon
396.article_body: Gopal Krishna Gokhale bridge in Mumbai's Andheri has been declared unsafe by a consultancy firm hired by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) and may be shut for vehicular traffic from Monday. The firm said bridge's elements like RCC columns and girders have lost their strength due to corrosion. BMC has requested Mumbai Traffic Police to work on alternative route for motorists.

397.title: Couple fills pothole with soil on B'luru road after 'narrowly escaping death'
397.article_body: A couple filled up a pothole with soil after they apparently 'narrowly escaped death' in Bengaluru's Malleshwaram, a Twitter handle that shared the clip of the incident claimed. "This is [the] state of #NammaBengaluru roads...wake up," the tweet by @SpeakUpBengalur, which tagged BBMP Commissioner and CM Basavaraj Bommai, read. At least three people died due to potholes in Bengaluru recently.

398.title: Will solve problems faced by offices on Bengaluru's ORR: Minister
398.article_body: Bengaluru's civic body will hold a meeting on November 14 and examine the situation of the Outer Ring Road, minister CN Ashwath Narayan has said. The assurance came after the civic body received complaints from companies that have office spaces on Outer Ring Road and from residents who live there. Narayan also said service roads in Bengaluru will be upgraded.

399.title: Gerard Piqué announces retirement from football after 14 years with Barcelona
399.article_body: Spanish defender Gerard Piqué has announced his retirement from football after 14 years with Barcelona. Sharing a video on social media, Piqué stated that Barcelona's La Liga match against Almería on Saturday will be the last match of his career. The 35-year-old has played 615 matches for Barcelona, winning eight La Liga titles and three Champions League titles.

400.title: Schools in Noida & Greater Noida to hold online classes till Nov 8 amid pollution
400.article_body: Schools in Noida and Greater Noida will hold online classes for students of Classes 1-8 till November 8 in view of rising pollution in Delhi-NCR, as per an official order. Schools have also been told to hold online classes for students of Classes 9-12 "as far as possible". All outdoor activities in schools are also banned until further orders.

401.title: Don't look at fake fielding as reason for not reaching target: Harsha to Bangladesh fans
401.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle, in a message to Bangladesh fans, said, "Please don't look at fake fielding or wet conditions as a reason for not reaching the target." He added, "If one of the batters had stayed till the end, Bangladesh could have won it. We are all guilty of it...when we search for excuses, we don't grow."
